DOC.brief_summary: This pilot clinical trial study image surgery diagnose patient prostate , bladder , kidney cancer . New diagnostic imaging procedure , may find prostate , bladder , kidney cancer
DOC.brief_title: Imaging During Surgery Diagnosing Patients With Prostate , Bladder , Kidney Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . The primary objective pilot study assess ability fluorescent image photoacoustic imaging ( PAI ) clinical set distinguish benign malignant tissue . SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : I . To qualitatively determine possible benefit PAI fluorescent image traditional white light image . OUTLINE : Patients undergo fluorescence image PAI robot assist laparoscopic surgery .
DOC.criteria: Patients must pathologic confirmation prostate cancer , bladder cancer , kidney cancer base previous biopsy procedure OR strong concern kidney malignancy base compute tomography ( CT ) magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) image Ability understand willingness sign write informed consent document Patients surgical history anatomic variant would preclude robot assist laparoscopic approach surgery ( i.e . history ventral hernia repair mesh ) Patients medical comorbidities tolerate laparoscopic surgery secondary intraabdominal carbon dioxide insufflation Patients document allergy adverse drug reaction indocyanine green baseline serum creatinine great 1.5 mg/dL
